title: Omicron, Supply-Chain Troubles to Slow Growth, World Bank Says
sub_head: Bank forecasts 4.1% growth in 2022, down from 5.5% last year
body:
WASHINGTON—The global economy is poised to slow down in 2022, the World Bank forecast Tuesday, citing the effects of the Omicron variant, supply-chain disruptions, labor shortages and the winding down of government economic support.
The headwinds will slow economic growth to 4.1% in 2022, down from 5.5% last year, which was the strongest postrecession pace in 80 years, according to the World Bank’s semiannual Global Economic Prospects report.
